long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Domain Redirect Tracker helps you monitor and understand website redirects as you browse the web. This lightweight extension keeps track of how many times each website redirects you to different pages, providing valuable insights into your browsing experience.
🔍 Key Features:

Real-time tracking of domain redirects
Daily statistics reset at midnight
Clean, easy-to-read interface
Sort domains by number of redirects
One-click data clearing
Zero impact on browsing speed
Privacy-focused - all data stored locally

📊 Perfect for:

Web developers debugging redirect chains
Security-conscious users monitoring suspicious redirects
Digital marketers analyzing affiliate redirects
Anyone interested in understanding their browsing patterns

💡 How it works:

Install the extension
Browse the web normally
Click the extension icon to see redirect counts for each domain
Data automatically resets daily at midnight
Clear data anytime with one click

🔒 Privacy & Security:

No data collection or transmission
All information stored locally on your device
No account or sign-up required
No ads or tracking

💻 Technical Details:

Lightweight (<100KB)
Updates automatically
Compatible with Chrome 88+
Works on Windows, Mac, and Linux

🆓 Completely free and open source!
👉 Get started:
Install the extension and click its icon in your toolbar to begin tracking domain redirects. The interface is intuitive and requires no configuration.
📝 Note: This extension requires permission to read website redirects to function properly. It only tracks the number of redirects and doesn't store any personal data or browsing history.
